The Shiba Inu volatility level has remained rather high through the ups and downs of the market which could bode well for the meme coinâ€™s price. According to data from IntoTheBlock, the SHIB volatility levels are still holding firmly above 60%. So what could this mean for the price?

entry.title: Iris Energy Acquires 7,000 Next-Gen T21 Bitcoin Miners in Deal With Bitmain
entry.summary:
The Australia-based and Nasdaq-listed Iris Energy recently announced the acquisition of 1.3 exahash per second (EH/s) capacity in Bitmainâ€™s latest Antminer T21 models. This purchase boosts Iris Energyâ€™s proprietary mining capacity to a notable 8.3 EH/s.
Iris Energy Secures 1.3 EH/s in Latest Bitmain Deal
Iris Energy (Nasdaq: IREN) announced on Thursday its procurement of 7,000 next-generation T21 bitcoin (BTC) miners from Bitmain Technologies. The deal, amounting to roughly $18.6 million, translates to a cost of $14 per terahash. Bitmain has agreed to postpone 20% of this sum until May 30, 2024, while Iris Energy plans to settle the balance through structured payments.
At the end of October, Bitmain introduced the T21 series, an air-cooled unit boasting up to 190 terahash per second â€¦

entry.title: Binance And Banking Partner Collaborate To Establish Worldâ€™s First Triparty Crypto Arrangement
entry.summary:
Binance, the worldâ€™s largestÂ cryptocurrency exchange, recently announced the successful execution of the worldâ€™s first cryptocurrency triparty arrangement in collaboration with a third-party banking partner.Â
According to the announcement, the solution allows institutional investors to securely store their trading collateral off-exchange with what Binance calls a â€œtrusted bank.â€
Binance Expands Services With Triparty Solution
The triparty arrangement marks the initiation of a series of pilot projects introduced by Binance, making it the sole cryptocurrency exchange to offer such a solution.Â
By addressing the issue of counterparty risk, a key concern for institutional investors, this arrangement replicates a framework commonly observed in traditional financial markets.Â
It allowsâ€¦

entry.title: Slumbering Bitcoin Cache Awakens After More Than a Decade, Transacting $3.77 Million
entry.summary:
In September and October 2023, a surge in activity was observed as numerous dormant bitcoin wallets from 2012 reawakened, transacting millions in bitcoin after lying inactive for more than ten years. Despite this flurry of activity, there were no further movements from these wallets for the majority of November, following a modest transfer of ten bitcoins on Halloween. However, on November 30, an intriguing development occurred when a vintage bitcoin address from 2012, which had been inactive for nearly eleven years, suddenly became active again, spending $3.77 million.
After Years of Dormancy, Bitcoin Wallet Reactivates With a $3.77 Million Move
The resurgence recorded in September saw a significant number of these 2012 wallets come back to life, marking a noticeable shift in the pattâ€¦

entry.title: Ethereum Exodus: Validators Jump Ship â€“ Whatâ€™s Driving The Mass Departure?
entry.summary:
Ethereumâ€™s staking pool dynamics have undergone a significant transformation amidst the buzz surrounding Binance and CZâ€™s legal challenges and the heightened regulatory scrutiny on centralized exchanges.
Over the past few weeks, there has been a discernible shift in the dynamics of the Ethereum staking pool that indicates a significant slowdown in the rate of validator growth. Due to this change, there was a decrease in the daily issuance of Ethereum (ETH), which was a direct result of the volume of ETH that was actively staking in the pool.
Ethereum Validator Exodus: Whatâ€™s Going On?
According to Glassnodeâ€™s analysis, there has been a high level of about 1,018 validator exits every day since early October, which has coincided with an increase in spot prices for cryptocurrencies. Wâ€¦

entry.title: Brazil Passes 15% Tax on Offshore Crypto Holdings
entry.summary: The Brazilian Senate has passed legislation proposing an income tax on crypto gains from offshore exchanges, awaiting final approval from the country's president. This proposal is slated for potential enactment on January 1. The bill aims to introduce a levy of 15% on all earnings garnered from cryptocurrencies held on offshore exchanges, Cointelegraph reported. If authorized, this tax legislation would impact Brazilians who earn more than $1,200 from foreign exchanges and investment funds with a single shareholder. Brazil's Fast-Paced Crypto Landscape The anticipated revenue from this tax reform is substantial, with the government targeting $4 billion for the forthcoming year. Despite its potential financial implications, the legislation has met criticisâ€¦

entry.summary:
On Wednesday, following the marketâ€™s closure, major U.S. indices concluded the day unchanged, coming off a rise the previous day. â€œDAOs are almost universally stupid and doomed because â€˜crypto communitiesâ€™ are often exclusively interested in short-term profits, the hype is worth more than actual deliveries, and nobody has any incentive to build anything,â€ Marcus stated.

entry.title: Bitcoin Blunder: Mining Giant Set To Return $3 Million Fee After Record Transaction Mishap
entry.summary:
AntPool, a prominent Bitcoin mining pool, has made headlines by agreeing to refund an unusually high transaction fee of $3 million.
This decision follows the accidental payment of this fee by a Bitcoin user, setting a new record for a single transaction fee in US dollar terms.
A Bitcoin Anomaly And AntPoolâ€™s Response
The incident unfolded last week when a Bitcoin transaction included a fee of 83.65 BTC, equivalent to roughly $3.1 million, to transfer 55.77 BTC worth around $2.1 million. This extraordinary fee, amounting to over 120,528 times the usual rate, was initially frozen by AntPoolâ€™s risk control system.
The transaction, which drastically reduced the senderâ€™s balance before the transaction of 139.42 BTC worth $5.2 million, was processed in block 818,087 mined by AntPool. Uâ€¦

A cybercriminal, who has been actively communicating with Kyberswap, issued a new onchain directive, this time insisting on â€œcomplete executive control over Kyber (the company).â€ This captivating onchain communication to the Kyberswap crew comes after the hackerâ€™s initial request for the team to engage in more amiable and cooperative discussions.
Kyberswap Attacker Claims â€˜Kyber Directorâ€™ Title, Demands Absolute Authority
The individual responsible for the Kyberswap security breach has conveyed a desire for absolute authority over Kyber, the company, and temporary control over the Kberdao governance structure. This revelation followed the $47 million breach at Kyberswap, after which the team established communication with the suspected perpetrator. The day prior, the assailant stressedâ€¦

entry.title: Goodbye To BUSD: Binance Announces Complete Phase-Out By December
entry.summary:
In a significant development, Binance revealed that it will no longer be supporting its BUSD stablecoin. Binance will remove BUSD from both spot and margin trading pairings in a staggered manner, encouraging users to move their BUSD holdings to other assets.
The exchange made a calculated decision with this choice, forcing consumers to adjust to shifting trading pairings and look into other stablecoin possibilities in the constantly changing cryptocurrency market.
The move, which takes effect on December 15, 2023, is a result of regulatory pressure that Paxos, the BUSD issuer, had to deal with.
Regulatory Impact On BUSD And Binance: SEC Actions And NYDFS Directive
The regulatory steps taken in February by the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), which identified BUSD as aâ€¦

entry.title: The U.S. in Crypto: Domestic Chaos, Global Ambitions
entry.summary: In the complex realm of cryptocurrency regulation, the U.S. Treasury has boldly extended its reach, seeking expanded powers that transcend national borders. Deputy Secretary of the Treasury Wally Adeyemo's impassioned plea to Congress for extraterritorial control over stablecoins, notably targeting Tether, adds a layer of complexity to the ongoing domestic regulatory conundrum. As Adeyemo presents a set of common-sense recommendations, it underscores the inherent challenges faced by the U.S. in regulating its burgeoning crypto industry. While the nation grapples with internal complexities, the audacious move raises a thought-provoking question: Can a country entrenched in domestic crypto intricacies successfully navigate the intricate global landscape? Cryptic Ambitionsâ€¦

entry.title: The Rise Of Ordinals And NFTs On The Medium Of Bitcoin
entry.summary: The Ordinals protocol was introduced to Bitcoin in early 2023 at a most opportune time. Bitcoin had nearly two years of low transaction fees from the lack of demand to actually send Bitcoin transactions. Bitcoin is considered to be the most secure blockchain in the world, but that security depends on miners who receive their revenue from transaction fees and block rewards. As part of the predetermined supply schedule, the block rewards are expected to be halved around April 2024 which would further drastically cut the miner revenue. To support the miners, Bitcoin needed something new to spur growth, and that was Ordinals. Ordinals drove huge demand to send Bitcoin transactions. Over $100 million (USD) worth of transaction fees have been spent so far this year just to create inscriptions, oâ€¦

entry.title: Why OTK Is Making Video Games
entry.summary: One True King (OTK) Chief Strategy Officer Zachary Diaz tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about OTK's long-term strategy and vision to become a content creator-powered media and video games company.

entry.title: 5 Questions With SCENE: LoVid
entry.summary:
Artistic duo LoVid, aka Tali Hinkis and Kyle Lapidus, joins 5 Questions with SCENE to answer burning questions about art, lettuce, and the hellscape (in someoneâ€™s opinion) that is Miami.
Video shot and edited by Vincent Roazzi Jr.

entry.title: Barney on DeFi, Privacy, and Vega
entry.summary:
This week our host is joined by Barney the founder of Vega Protocol.
They discuss the current state of DeFi, what's wrong with the apps being built today, whether or not privacy matters when its only applied to an L2, and most importantly-- which form of sales tax is the sexiest.

entry.title: Why Is Phantom Galaxies Releasing Two Versions of Its Game?
entry.summary: Animoca Brands-owned Blowfish Studios is building a space mech pilot game called Phantom Galaxies. Blowfish Cofounder Ben Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his plans for the game's release.

entry.title: Sophie Maxx on NFTs, Augmented Reality, and Fashion
entry.summary: This week our host is joined by Sophie Maxx (Web3Maxx) to discuss NFTs, augmented reality, the metaverse, how blockchain is sneaking into the fashion world, and more!

entry.title: 5 Questions With SCENE: Kevin Rose
entry.summary:
Kevin Rose, co-founder and CEO of PROOF and co-creator of the hit Moonbirds NFT collection, joins 5 Questions with SCENE to answer some hard-hitting questions about his childhood dreams, his wifeâ€™s candy preferences, and his undying love of rap music.
Video shot and edited by Vincent Roazzi Jr.

entry.title: What Happened to Atari's Token? Inside Atari's Blockchain Plans
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin chats with Atari X director Tyler Drewitz about what happened with Atari's token plans, whether a token is coming, and what Atari games might be getting the blockchain treatment. Oh, and there's lots of Easter eggs.
